task.description: 设计一种在25度下溶剂电极材料中贵金属的8组分DES溶剂

components.name: Choline chloride
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond acceptor, low-cost, biodegradable quaternary ammonium salt

components.name: Ethylene glycol
components.function: Strong hydrogen bond donor, lowers viscosity and melting point

components.name: Glycerol
components.function: Polyol-based donor enhancing solvation of polar species and stabilizing metal complexes

components.name: Urea
components.function: Amide-type donor aiding in nitrogen coordination to noble metals

components.name: Lactic acid
components.function: Carboxylic acid providing protonation capacity and chelating ability for metal dissolution

components.name: Zinc chloride
components.function: Enhances oxidative dissolution of noble metals via complexation

components.name: Thiourea
components.function: Sulfur- and nitrogen-donor ligand promoting selective coordination to gold, platinum, palladium

components.name: Dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)
components.function: Reduces overall viscosity, improves ionic conductivity and solubility of organometallic species

reasoning: This 8-component DES integrates multiple HBDs and functional additives to synergistically enhance the solvation and oxidative dissolution of noble metals at ambient temperature. The combination of polyols, amides, carboxylic acids, and sulfur donors provides diverse coordination modes for metals like Au, Pd, and Pt. DMSO and ZnCl₂ further tune polarity and introduce Lewis acidity, enabling effective electron transfer. Multi-component design allows fine control over viscosity, dielectric constant, and redox potential—critical for electrode applications.

components.name: Dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)
components.function: Reduces overall viscosity, improves ionic conductivity and solubility of organometallic species

final_result.reasoning: This 8-component DES integrates multiple HBDs and functional additives to synergistically enhance the solvation and oxidative dissolution of noble metals at ambient temperature. The combination of polyols, amides, carboxylic acids, and sulfur donors provides diverse coordination modes for metals like Au, Pd, and Pt. DMSO and ZnCl₂ further tune polarity and introduce Lewis acidity, enabling effective electron transfer. Multi-component design allows fine control over viscosity, dielectric constant, and redox potential—critical for electrode applications.
supporting_evidence: Choline chloride–urea and choline chloride–ethylene glycol DES are well-documented for metal processing (Abbott et al., 2004; 2006).
Lactic acid-containing DES show enhanced dissolution of gold due to combined proton and complexation effects (Zhang et al., 2020).
Thiourea forms stable complexes with Au(I/III) and Pd(II) in acidic DES (Hartley et al., 2021).
Zinc chloride acts as a Lewis acid catalyst in DES to promote metal oxidation (Tsuda et al., 2003).
DMSO as co-solvent reduces viscosity and enhances mass transfer in multi-component DES (Mourão et al., 2015).
Multi-HBD systems exhibit lower eutectic points and improved solvation vs binary DES (Pauly et al., 2011).
final_result.synergy_explanation: Choline chloride accepts hydrogen bonds from ethylene glycol, glycerol, urea, and lactic acid, forming a deep eutectic network stabilized by extensive H-bonding. Thiourea and lactic acid cooperatively coordinate noble metal ions, while ZnCl₂ activates metal surfaces through oxidative chlorination. DMSO disrupts excessive H-bonding, lowering viscosity and improving ion mobility. Together, these components create a conductive, low-melting (≤25°C), and chemically active medium ideal for noble metal electrode processes.
